name: lopsidedly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that has one side bigger, higher, etc. than the other: I grinned lopsidedly and asked her if she wanted a drink. His lopsidedly handsome face looked tense.
in a way that is not equally balanced: In the last election, 45 percent of Americans lived in counties that were lopsidedly Republican or Democratic. Some children are lopsidedly gifted, with very strong interests in one direction.
More examplesFewer examplesThe little girl ran lopsidedly towards her.When he talked, his lips moved lopsidedly.There may be a lopsidedly heavy turnout among younger voters.
